comments:
When exiting a program on JDK1.4 (i.e. hit a breakpoint and resumed to exit the 
program), the following appeared in the console:

Internal error logged from JDI debug model:
com.sun.jdi.InternalException: Got error code in reply: 112
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.defaultReplyErrorHandler(MirrorIm
pl.java:240)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.ThreadReferenceImpl.isSuspended(ThreadRefere
nceImpl.java:225)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread.initialize(JDIThread.ja
va:233)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread.<init>(JDIThread.java:2
01)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugTarget.createThread(JDIDe
bugTarget.java:445)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugTarget$ThreadStartHandler
.handleEvent(JDIDebugTarget.java:1771)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.dispatch(EventDis
patcher.java:109)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher$1.run(EventDispat
cher.java:143)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1231
)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.run(EventDispatch
er.java:160)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)

I had a similar problem running a main on JDK 1.4.0-beta 2. The message was
"Launching failed. Exception starting VM"
Asked Jim Thomas to file a new bug, as the problem does not look related.

Unable to reproduce. Verified code to see that we are catching a VM disconnect 
when a thread starts as a VM is terminating.

Re-opened. I found the following in the workspace log:

error code 112 indicates "VM_DEAD" according to JDWP spec.

Fixed. The error code VM_DEAD was not handled by the default JDI error handler. 
Changed to throw VMDisconnectedException, which is handled properly by the code.
